benchmark_details.name: HALLUCINOGEN
benchmark_details.overview: HALLUCINOGEN is a novel visual question answering (VQA) benchmark that employs contextual reasoning prompts as hallucination attacks to evaluate the extent of hallucination in state-of-the-art Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs). It provides a comprehensive study of the implicit reasoning capabilities of LVLMs by categorizing visual entities into salient and latent entities and designing various hallucination attacks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) and their performance on complex vision-language tasks.
audience: developers in the field of AI
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Current attacks are centered on foundational vision-language tasks such as Visual Question Answering (VQA).

data.source: MS-COCO and NIH Chest X-ray datasets
data.annotation: Each image is associated with 15 diverse implicit hallucination attack prompts.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is computed based on the proportion of correctly answered questions.
methodology.interpretation: Lower accuracy indicates a higher degree of hallucination in the generated responses.
methodology.baseline_results: Most LVLMs show performance close to random guessing when tested with HALLUCINOGEN attacks.
methodology.validation: Extensive qualitative and quantitative evaluations of eleven LVLMs against hallucination attacks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset complies with ethical guidelines, ensuring no personal data is included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study adheres to relevant data protection regulations.
